data: Honours for Procula, Plaetorius, Galeo and Longina

A large slab of coarse grey-brown stone. Intact and finished along the upper edge, intact but lightly damaged on the right edge, intact below; broken on the left side. The rear is roughly finished. The stone is thickest at the top, thinnest lower left.

The text appears centered on the stone (uneven right margin, left margin missing). Line 1 is largest, with line 5 also given prominence by larger size than 2-4 and slightly greater spacing. The final three lines are smaller and less regular.
"Un periodo oscillante tra la seconda meta del I sec d.C. ed il II d.C" by letter forms)
First published in 1976, but no information on original discoveryis recorded.
Prag 2022-06-07, on display in the civic museum.
Photo J.Prag courtesy Museo Civico di Termini Imerese

A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions
Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese
Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese, vol. 9/8, Kokalos Supplementi / Sikelika serie storica (Palermo / Rome, 1994)
Una iscrizione inedita di Termini Imerese. Nuovi magistrati nella colonia di Thermae

Livia Bivona, «Una iscrizione inedita di Termini Imerese. Nuovi magistrati nella colonia di Thermae», in Studi di storia antica offerti dagli allievi a Eugenio Manni (Rome: Giorgio Bretschneider, 1976), 55–66
Appunti su società ed economia nella Sicilia d'età imperiale

G. L. Gregori, «Appunti su società ed economia nella Sicilia d’età imperiale», in Pignora amicitiae. Scritti di storia antica e di storiografia offerti a Mario Mazza, a c. di M. Cassia et al., vol. 2 (Acireale-Rome: Bonanno editore, 2012), 299–320

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy;
  • 2: viro in compressed ligature/monogram at line end

English translation

Jonathan Prag

To [---]a Procula, daughter of Lucius... [(name)] Plaetorius, son of Spurius, of the Claudian tribe, quaestor, aedile, duumvir, ... [(name) --]ius Galeo, son of Quintus, of the Quirina tribe, to whom the decurial order decreed aedilician honours, [---]a Longina, daughter of Lucius. [(name)] Proculus, of the Claudian tribe, quaestor four times, prefect pro duumvir, duumvir quinqennalis, military tribune of the Legio VI Ferrata.

Italy Sicily Termini Imerese Museo Civico Baldassare Romano 34 Latin

A large slab of coarse grey-brown stone. Intact and finished along the upper edge, intact but lightly damaged on the right edge, intact below; broken on the left side. The rear is roughly finished. The stone is thickest at the top, thinnest lower left.

limestone plaque 48.3-48.7 45 6.1-7.5

The text appears centered on the stone (uneven right margin, left margin missing). Line 1 is largest, with line 5 also given prominence by larger size than 2-4 and slightly greater spacing. The final three lines are smaller and less regular.

chiselled

Tall letters, showing some narrowness/compression in the module; occasional use of ligature and hedera, with a distinctive form of the letter G. Note that the final three lines appear to be in a different hand, less regular, with a different interpunct, differences notable in e.g. E, G and R.

Line 1 73-75 Line 2 38-40 Line 3 38-42 Line 4 35-39 Line 5 44-47 Interlineation line 1 to 2

The final three lines appear to be in a different hand, less regular, with a different interpunct, differences notable in e.g. E, G and R.

Line 6 27-35 Line 7 34-38 Line 8 28-31 Thermae Himeraeae Termini Imerese 37.98365, 13.69555 "Un periodo oscillante tra la seconda meta del I sec d.C. ed il II d.C" by letter forms) First published in 1976, but no information on original discoveryis recorded.
